Delete High availability section.

Now We have HA guide,delete high availability section in the admin guide.

Closes-Bug: #1363350

commit_message:
Use oslo.i18n, properly mark LOG messages

oslo.i18n provides the i18n function that were provided by
oslo-incubator's gettextutils module.

Use _LE, _LW and _LI for logging of errors, warnings and info.

Import _ where needed, oslo.i18n deprecated the builtin method.

Fix concatenation of translated string with normal string.

Change-Id: I626c74d0bd4e8786770fa063adc4f174ff2c2c6d

commit_message:
Implement BlockDeviceMappings for LaunchConfiguration

We should support the BlockDeviceMappings for
AWS::AutoScaling::LaunchConfiguration resource to be
compatible with AWSCloudFormation, thus we can take
BlockDeviceMappings for instances in AutoScalingGroup
and InstanceGroup.

Implements blueprint implement-launchconfiguration-bdm

Change-Id: I26b13b8e98190fa4bb4223b5eed9970648d7ee35

added_lines: def _get_port_info(self, ni_id=None, instance_id=None): port_id = None port_rsrc = None if ni_id: port_rsrc = self.neutron().list_ports(id=ni_id)['ports'][0] port_id = ni_id elif instance_id: ports = self.neutron().list_ports(device_id=instance_id) port_rsrc = ports['ports'][0] port_id = port_rsrc['id'] return port_id, port_rsrc def _neutron_add_gateway_router(self, float_id, network_id): router = VPC.router_for_vpc(self.neutron(), network_id) if router is not None: floatingip = self.neutron().show_floatingip(float_id) floating_net_id = \ floatingip['floatingip']['floating_network_id'] self.neutron().add_gateway_router( router['id'], {'network_id': floating_net_id}) def _neutron_update_floating_ip(self, allocationId, port_id=None, ignore_not_found=False): try: self.neutron().update_floatingip(allocationId, {'floatingip': {'port_id': port_id}}) except Exception as e: if ignore_not_found: self.client_plugin('neutron').ignore_not_found(e) else: raise def _nova_remove_floating_ip(self, instance_id, eip, ignore_not_found=False): server = None try: server = self.nova().servers.get(instance_id) server.remove_floating_ip(eip) except Exception as e: is_not_found = self.client_plugin('nova').is_not_found(e) iue = self.client_plugin('nova').is_unprocessable_entity(e) if ((not ignore_not_found and is_not_found) or (not is_not_found and not iue)): raise return server ni_id = self.properties[self.NETWORK_INTERFACE_ID] instance_id = self.properties[self.INSTANCE_ID] port_id, port_rsrc = self._get_port_info(ni_id, instance_id) if not port_id or not port_rsrc: LOG.warn(_('Skipping association, resource not specified')) self._neutron_add_gateway_router(float_id, network_id) self._neutron_update_floating_ip(float_id, port_id) instance_id = self.properties[self.INSTANCE_ID] eip = self.properties[self.EIP] self._nova_remove_floating_ip(instance_id, eip, ignore_not_found=True) self._neutron_update_floating_ip(float_id, port_id=None, ignore_not_found=True)
deleted_lines: port_id = None port_rsrc = None if self.properties[self.NETWORK_INTERFACE_ID]: port_id = self.properties[self.NETWORK_INTERFACE_ID] port_rsrc = self.neutron().list_ports(id=port_id)['ports'][0] elif self.properties[self.INSTANCE_ID]: instance_id = self.properties[self.INSTANCE_ID] ports = self.neutron().list_ports(device_id=instance_id) port_rsrc = ports['ports'][0] port_id = port_rsrc['id'] else: LOG.debug('Skipping association, resource not specified') router = VPC.router_for_vpc(self.neutron(), network_id) if router is not None: floatingip = self.neutron().show_floatingip(float_id) floating_net_id = \ floatingip['floatingip']['floating_network_id'] self.neutron().add_gateway_router( router['id'], {'network_id': floating_net_id}) self.neutron().update_floatingip( float_id, {'floatingip': {'port_id': port_id}}) try: instance_id = self.properties[self.INSTANCE_ID] server = self.nova().servers.get(instance_id) if server: server.remove_floating_ip(self.properties[self.EIP]) except Exception as e: is_not_found = self.client_plugin('nova').is_not_found(e) is_unprocessable_entity = self.client_plugin('nova').\ is_unprocessable_entity(e) if (not is_not_found and not is_unprocessable_entity): raise try: self.neutron().update_floatingip( float_id, {'floatingip': {'port_id': None}}) except Exception as ex: self.client_plugin('neutron').ignore_not_found(ex)

commit_message:
Fix delete failed because association creation failed

Modify if the eip association is not created successful,
don't try to delete it.

Implements blueprint implement-ec2eip-updatable

Change-Id: Ifa883c31214c4cc367751766efcb6b775d1b4ffe

added_lines: self._check_subworkflow_completion(exec_db) def _check_subworkflow_completion(self, exec_db): if not exec_db.parent_task_id: return if exec_db.state == states.SUCCESS: self._engine_client.on_task_result( exec_db.parent_task_id, wf_base.TaskResult(data=exec_db.output) ) elif exec_db.state == states.ERROR: err_msg = 'Failed subworkflow [execution_id=%s]' % exec_db.id self._engine_client.on_task_result( exec_db.parent_task_id, wf_base.TaskResult(error=err_msg) )
deleted_lines: if exec_db.state == states.SUCCESS and exec_db.parent_task_id: self._process_subworkflow_output(exec_db) def _process_subworkflow_output(self, exec_db): self._engine_client.on_task_result( exec_db.parent_task_id, wf_base.TaskResult(data=exec_db.output) )

commit_message:
Populate host field for cg in the unit test

The host field for consistencygroup is missing in the test.
As a result, the test failed when extract_host is called in
the pool aware scheduler patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/98715/34

Change-Id: I6ded78baa7eb5c640c9fce3303942c934663e4f9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/64/118064/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: consistencygroup['host'] = 'host@backend'

commit_message:
Create SAML generation route and controller

In order to take advantage of the new SAML generation code, we
need to create a route and controller in OS-FEDERATION.

corresponding api spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/113998/

Implements: bp keystone-to-keystone-federation

Change-Id: Ib27921fa1fcff8760836e065ede1e90d1330fd16
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/38/114138/32 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: SAML_GENERATION_ROUTE = '/auth/OS-FEDERATION/saml2' def _create_generate_saml_request(self, token_id, region_id): return { "auth": { "identity": { "methods": [ "token" ], "token": { "id": token_id } }, "scope": { "region": { "id": region_id } } } } def _create_region_with_url(self): ref = self.new_region_ref() ref['url'] = self.RECIPIENT r = self.post('/regions', body={'region': ref}) return r.json['region']['id'] def _fetch_valid_token(self): auth_data = self.build_authentication_request( user_id=self.user['id'], password=self.user['password'], project_id=self.project_id) resp = self.v3_authenticate_token(auth_data) token_id = resp.headers.get('X-Subject-Token') return token_id def test_generate_saml_route(self): self._load_federation_config_options() region_id = self._create_region_with_url() token_id = self._fetch_valid_token() body = self._create_generate_saml_request(token_id, region_id) self.post(self.SAML_GENERATION_ROUTE, body=body, response_content_type='text/xml', expected_status=200) # assert some stuff about the response

commit_message:
Add client support in Cinder for volume replication

Provide Cinder client support to manage volume replication.
Cinder-specs available at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/98308/

Change-Id: Id60bacbcc113d42730e822b29b2fa78be94d3276
Implements: blueprint volume-replication
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient refs/changes/15/110115/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _find_replication_relationship(cs, relationship): """Get a replication relationship by ID.""" return utils.find_resource(cs.relationships, relationship) @utils.arg('relationship', metavar='<relationship>', help='ID of the relationship.') @utils.service_type('volumev2') def do_replication_show(cs, args): """Show details about a replication relationship.""" rel = _find_replication_relationship(cs, args.relationship) info = dict() info.update(rel._info) info.pop('links', None) utils.print_dict(info) @utils.arg('--primary', metavar='<primary>', default=None, help='Filter results by primary volume') @utils.arg('--secondary', metavar='<secondary>', default=None, help='Filter results by secondary volume') @utils.arg('--status', metavar='<status>', default=None, help='Filter results by status volume') @utils.service_type('volumev2') def do_replication_list(cs, args): """List all the replication relationships.""" search_opts = {} if args.primary is not None: volume = utils.find_volume(cs, args.primary) search_opts['primary_id'] = volume.id if args.secondary is not None: volume = utils.find_volume(cs, args.secondary) search_opts['secondary_id'] = volume.id if args.status is not None: search_opts['status'] = args.status relationships = cs.relationships.list(search_opts=search_opts) utils.print_list(relationships, ['ID', 'Primary ID', 'Secondary ID', 'Status']) @utils.arg('relationship', metavar='<relationship>', help='ID of the relationship.') @utils.service_type('volumev2') def do_replication_promote(cs, args): """Promote a secondary volume to primary for a relationship.""" rel = _find_replication_relationship(cs, args.relationship) rel.promote() @utils.arg('relationship', metavar='<relationship>', help='ID of the relationship.') @utils.service_type('volumev2') def do_replication_sync(cs, args): """Sync the secondary volume with primary for a relationship.""" rel = _find_replication_relationship(cs, args.relationship) rel.sync() @utils.arg('relationship', metavar='<relationship>', help='ID of the relationship.') @utils.service_type('volumev2') def do_replication_test(cs, args): """Test replication by creating a clone of the secondary volume.""" rel = _find_replication_relationship(cs, args.relationship) rel.test()

revisions:

Sometimes after reverting VMs snapshots keystone client
can't get authorization token due to 401 unauthorized error.
We should handle this exception in tests and try to redo

Closes-bug: #1365376
"}]
commit_message:
Add handling of 401 error from keystone (systests)

Sometimes after reverting VMs snapshots keystone client
can't get authorization token due to 401 unauthorized error.
We should handle this exception in tests and try to redo
keystone authorization.

Change-Id: I499855a6b13eacee4894a837d3170b9f550cf74d
Closes-bug: #1365376
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/03/119003/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except exceptions.Unauthorized: logger.warning("Keystone returned unauthorized error, trying " "to pass authentication.") self.authenticate() return self.keystone.auth_token

commit_message:
Add Cisco FC Zoning plugin to the FC ZoneManager

The Cisco FC Zoning plugin allows for the automated creation,
deletion and modification of zones in zonesets.  The Cisco
FC zoning plugin supports both basic and enhanced zoning and
supports vsans.

Implements: blueprint cisco-fc-zone-driver
Change-Id: Icf176b6f46f1b1662f0a99ffaa226789661f611e

subject: Small Fix for FakeServerConnection
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-29 02:30:44.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/test_sysmeta.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/3a7f80aa472794951461cf95fac4ec029167c17d', 'message': 'Small Fix for FakeServerConnection

Current FakeServerConnection might cause 499 error
in some unit tests because sent (put) data will be
overridden by new one every time.
e.g. When calling conn.queue.put() twice and more in
an object PUT sequence, we can use only a last chunk as
the body. This fixes it to merge all chunks as a body.

Change-Id: I463e9e2b454e3f3eb26950b3af4c8b8167a9a971
'}]
commit_message:
Small Fix for FakeServerConnection

Current FakeServerConnection might cause 499 error
in some unit tests because sent (put) data will be
overridden by new one every time.
e.g. When calling conn.queue.put() twice and more in
an object PUT sequence, we can use only a last chunk as
the body. This fixes it to merge all chunks as a body.

Change-Id: I463e9e2b454e3f3eb26950b3af4c8b8167a9a971

commit_message:
Run unit tests against a particular git branch

Solum runs unit tests always against the master
branch, which does not reflect the real dev flow.

This patch focuses on handling Github pull requests.
Solum trigger API is able to get a particular branch name
from request body sent by a Github webhook, and pass
it down to worker handler for running unit tests against
it.

Closes-bug: 1363249

Change-Id: I7ecdf626c99e16f9970ad4089020c95572c3da83
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/solum refs/changes/85/117885/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add V3 Nova API swap_volume_attachment tests

This patch adds V3 Nova API - swap_volume_attachment tests.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api-tests

Change-Id: Ic392e0c0cb760a8e15ad946e5e8da9b31243c54e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/39/87439/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2013 IBM Corp. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import testtools from tempest.api.compute import base from tempest.common.utils.linux import remote_client from tempest import config from tempest import test CONF = config.CONF class SwapVolumeV3Test(base.BaseV3ComputeTest): def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): super(SwapVolumeV3Test, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) self.server = None self.volume1 = None self.volume2 = None self.attached = False @classmethod def setUpClass(cls): super(SwapVolumeV3Test, cls).setUpClass() cls.device = CONF.compute.volume_device_name if not CONF.service_available.cinder: skip_msg = ("%s skipped as Cinder is not available" % cls.__name__) raise cls.skipException(skip_msg) def _detach(self, server_id, volume_id): if self.attached: self.servers_client.detach_volume(server_id, volume_id) self.volumes_client.wait_for_volume_status(volume_id, 'available') def _delete_volume(self): if self.volume: self.volumes_client.delete_volume(self.volume['id']) self.volume = None def _create_attach_swap(self): # Start a server and wait for it to become ready admin_pass = self.image_ssh_password resp, server = self.create_test_server(wait_until='ACTIVE', admin_password=admin_pass) self.server = server # Record addresses so that we can ssh later resp, server['addresses'] = \ self.servers_client.list_addresses(server['id']) # Create 2 volumes and wait for them to become ready resp, volume1 = self.volumes_client.create_volume(1, display_name='test1') self.volume1 = volume1 self.addCleanup(self._delete_volume, volume1['id']) self.volumes_client.wait_for_volume_status(volume1['id'], 'available') resp, volume2 = self.volumes_client.create_volume(1, display_name='test2') self.volume2 = volume2 self.addCleanup(self._delete_volume, volume2['id']) self.volumes_client.wait_for_volume_status(volume2['id'], 'available') # Attach the volume1 to the server self.servers_client.attach_volume(server['id'], volume1['id'], device='/dev/%s' % self.device) self.volumes_client.wait_for_volume_status(volume1['id'], 'in-use') self.attached = True self.addCleanup(self._detach, server['id'], volume1['id']) self.servers_client.swap_volume(server['id'], volume1['id'], volume2['id']) self.addCleanup(self._detach, server['id'], volume2['id']) @testtools.skipUnless(CONF.compute.run_ssh, 'SSH required for this test') @test.attr(type='gate') def test_attach_swap_detach_volume(self): # Stop and Start a server with an attached volume, ensuring that # the volume remains attached. self._create_attach_swap() server = self.server volume2 = self.volume2 self.servers_client.stop(server['id']) self.servers_client.wait_for_server_status(server['id'], 'SHUTOFF') self.servers_client.start(server['id']) self.servers_client.wait_for_server_status(server['id'], 'ACTIVE') linux_client = remote_client.RemoteClient(server, self.image_ssh_user, server['admin_password']) partitions = linux_client.get_partitions() self.assertIn(self.device, partitions) self._detach(server['id'], volume2['id']) self.attached = False self.servers_client.stop(server['id']) self.servers_client.wait_for_server_status(server['id'], 'SHUTOFF') self.servers_client.start(server['id']) self.servers_client.wait_for_server_status(server['id'], 'ACTIVE') linux_client = remote_client.RemoteClient(server, self.image_ssh_user, server['admin_password']) partitions = linux_client.get_partitions() self.assertNotIn(self.device, partitions)

commit_message:
Use MultiStrOpt for policy_dirs

We want to ensure that the values specified for directory names are
treated as strings, so use MultiStrOpt instead of the more general
ListOpt.

Change-Id: I46ab5d768b434133f681d9348ecb4c271d633c21

mixed together in this one logical line of code, which are further mixed
with two methods of closing parens and curly braces.

Besides being difficult to read, the mixture resulted in an off-by-one

Closes-Bug: 1363019
"}]
commit_message:
use one indentation style

There are two (or three, depending on how you count) indentations styles
mixed together in this one logical line of code, which are further mixed
with two methods of closing parens and curly braces.

Besides being difficult to read, the mixture resulted in an off-by-one
error that isn't caught by the version of hacking that Jenkins is using,
but is caught by the latest.

Change-Id: Idab3c80c720e0bfd5741dc9e07f841b5ac270960
Closes-Bug: 1363019

commit_message:
Change v3 aggregate API to v2.1

This patch changes v3 aggregate API to v2.1 and makes v2
unit tests share between v2 and v2.1.

The differences between v2 and v3 are described on the wiki page
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/NovaAPIv2tov3.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I95372d49ffacd12bdc8e2f6b60628c17f70d0eba

commit_message:
output-file option in stack-abandon

This patch adds --output-file, -O option in stack-abandon command.
If the option is specified, stack-abandon will output a result into
 the file.

Change-Id: Ic2518eae86d5f917d5227c6ab73062b665b5a89b
Closes-Bug: #1299023
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient refs/changes/90/96690/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @utils.arg('-O', '--output-file', metavar='<FILE>', help='Additional file to output abandon result. ' 'If the option is specified, the result will be' ' outputed into both stdout and <FILE>.') result = jsonutils.dumps(stack, indent=2) try: with open(args.output_file, "w") as f: f.write(result) except: logger.debug("can't create output file %s" % args.output_file) print result

commit_message:
Split requirements into py2 and py3 files

Since PBR now supports distinguishing between
a requirements file for py2 and a different requirements
file for py3 we should add the support for that separation
so that it is easier to package taskflow.

Change-Id: I3c5faa99a529bcb28aa0276b8d345a26f94b5af3

commit_message:
Avoid usage of insecure mktemp() function

This patch eliminates the use of the deprecated and insecure
tempfile.mktemp() function.  It has been replaced with secure
alternatives where temporary files are actually required.

Change-Id: I0a13d6d44cd1abc4b66fa33f39eea407617a01d5
SecurityImpact
Closes-bug: #1348869
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/93/109793/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: data = stats.print_stats() profile_img = tempfile.TemporaryFile() plt.savefig(profile_img, format='png', dpi=300) profile_img.seek(0) data = profile_img.read() os.close(profile_img)
deleted_lines: profile_tmp_all = tempfile.mktemp('.profile', 'all') stats.dump_stats(profile_tmp_all) data = open(profile_tmp_all).read() os.remove(profile_tmp_all) profile_img = tempfile.mktemp('.png', 'plot') plt.savefig(profile_img, dpi=300) data = open(profile_img).read() os.remove(profile_img)

commit_message:
Add support for cert-based access type

This patch adds support for cert-based access type.
The access_to parameter represents certificate's CN
(aka common name) to which access is denied or allowed
by the backend.

Partially-implements blueprint cert-based-access-type

Change-Id: I70c21397028e642bcf018ff254466046e38dcc3a

deleted_lines: 'Only ip and sid type are supported')

Restore auth_uri config option

Restore auth_uri config option which must be defined in
    [keyston_authtoken] section.

commit_message:
Changes V3 evacuate extension into v2.1

This patch changes v3 evacuate API to v2.1, and also share v2.1 and v2
test case.
The differences between v2 and v3 are described on the wiki page

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/NovaAPIv2tov3 .
Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: Ib105e367be5a921f1b9cade51204b224d99343ec

commit_message:
In benchmark observer worker, include claimed messages when listing

This a tiny change to make the observer behave more as you might
expect an auditing/diagnostic client to behave when obeserving
a task distribution queue.

Change-Id: Idcb8eb970c1f205b9fc7efdfeb860805b1a45640

subject: Fix a bug in Mellanox plugin RPC caused by secgroup RPC refactoring
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-01 13:40:01.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/mlnx/rpc_callbacks.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/d3ed330ca81d9663b1280a0386b572421ec48496', 'message': 'Fix a bug in Mellanox plugin RPC caused by secgroup RPC refactoring

SecurityGroupsRpcCallback RPC refactoring patch (commit 2781fce238)
moves get_port_from_device method from plugin RPC callback class to
plugin layer, but Mellanox plugin RPC callback was forgot to update
and as a result RPC calls from agents to Mellanox plugin fails.

Change-Id: I1aa82ac00c16a53a59a93087f0ca4ef281ee3f2b
Related-Bug: #1359416

commit_message:
Fix a bug in Mellanox plugin RPC caused by secgroup RPC refactoring

SecurityGroupsRpcCallback RPC refactoring patch (commit 2781fce238)
moves get_port_from_device method from plugin RPC callback class to
plugin layer, but Mellanox plugin RPC callback was forgot to update
and as a result RPC calls from agents to Mellanox plugin fails.

Change-Id: I1aa82ac00c16a53a59a93087f0ca4ef281ee3f2b
Related-Bug: #1359416

commit_message:
Use correct class path for token persistence backend

Keystone has moved over to using a new location for the token
persistence backends (drivers). The old values will continue to
work, but this will limit the deprecation warnings for an out
of the box devstack install.

Change-Id: I7c437788c8aee0106fa7f3c37617fbd1220291ef
bp: non-persistent-tokens

commit_message:
Watch .gitignore and check mimetype of files

Follow the rules set-out in .gitignore (based on the upstream code)
and only match files that seem to have a mime-type of a shell script.

Change-Id: I0df65e8e3a2ac77b720100715645fe9e7a84bf44

commit_message:
Updates to EC Design Spec

Based on conference call on 8/23, several updates were made
mainly to the reconstructor section as described in the
revision history.

Also added a section in the Reconstructor area on concurrency.

Change-Id: I9cdc22de645647ef14bbd1f9b69fa65c6d14eeb3
Implements: blueprint swift-ec

commit_message:
Added Release info to README

Previously we gave no one instructions about how to checkout the alpha.

This change adds those instructions.

Change-Id: I141a859cd43896357c96816593a3d492b47481ff
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress refs/changes/41/117641/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 5. Releases =========== If you want the latest and greatest or you would like to contribute code to Congress, you want the 'master' branch:: $ git checkout master If you want the last stable version of Congress, you want the alpha release:: $ git checkout 1.0.0a1 If you want to run the alpha release together with devstack, you may need to update congress/requirements.txt to include the dependencies required by the latest versions of Nova/Neutron. So replace 1.0.0a1:congress/requirements.txt with master:congress/requirements.txt.

commit_message:
Use anyjson if available

The anyjson picks the best/fastest json parser
than is what is included by default in python
so we should try to use it if it is available
and if not then just fallback to using the native
python one.

Co-Authored-By: Andrey Kurilin <akurilin@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I1001bfb0d84a19a6d1ca3f1265965e86ac09b551

subject: Properly detect grenade in check_logs script
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-03 19:31:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/d1e9bbefa0758f6809bf65ca92a26c8f3b485c44', 'message': "Properly detect grenade in check_logs script

The check logs script was not properly detecting grenade and would fail
grenade jobs if the logs were not clean. We don't want to do this
because the upgrade process is not log clean yet. Correct this by
setting grenade flag to true only if the DEVSTACK_GATE_GRENADE variable
has content.

Change-Id: Id8a339d78d981376b9af3a80aae8e4e18a68a85f
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-04 04:48:54.000000000', 'files': ['tools/check_logs.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/a5c669d7f0c0383edc8e5b961a4fd4b32044d04f', 'message': "Properly detect grenade in check_logs script

The check logs script was not properly detecting grenade and would fail
grenade jobs if the logs were not clean. We don't want to do this
because the upgrade process is not log clean yet. Correct this by
setting grenade flag to true only if the DEVSTACK_GATE_GRENADE variable
has content.

Change-Id: Id8a339d78d981376b9af3a80aae8e4e18a68a85f
"}]
commit_message:
Properly detect grenade in check_logs script

The check logs script was not properly detecting grenade and would fail
grenade jobs if the logs were not clean. We don't want to do this
because the upgrade process is not log clean yet. Correct this by
setting grenade flag to true only if the DEVSTACK_GATE_GRENADE variable
has content.

Change-Id: Id8a339d78d981376b9af3a80aae8e4e18a68a85f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/53/118753/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # DEVSTACK_GATE_GRENADE is either unset if grenade is not running # or a string describing what type of grenade run to perform. is_grenade = os.environ.get('DEVSTACK_GATE_GRENADE') != None

commit_message:
Fix tools/xen/functions for bashate errors

Change I205d675ff231c0403dd135eacc8d57b45317859f modified the matching
for bashate and it has started running on this file, whereas before it
wasn't.  This fixes the errors it is now picking up.

Change-Id: I7876b5c94d90f15e3b0228999c0750bfbebcaa1c

commit_message:
Add QoS support to IBM Storwize driver

IBM Storwize driver can be enabled with QoS support by setting the parameter
I/O throttling rate, which caps the amount of I/O.

This patch add the QoS configuration to the methods of create_volume,
create_volume_from_snapshot, create_cloned_volume and retype.

The QoS for IBM Storwize storage can be configured in 3 ways:
* Add the key "qos:IOThrottling" into a QoS spec and associate this QoS
spec with a volume type.
* Add the key "qos:IOThrottling" into the extra spec of a volume type.
* Add a metadata with the key "qos:IOThrottling".

Change-Id: I7c5c6726a61efad6a8ada9c5dcc31a9382ec79f9
implements-blueprint: cinder-storwize-driver-qos

commit_message:
Clusters API Implementation

adds clusters api, with mongodb sharding as the first implemenation.

Co-Authored-By: Michael Yu <michayu@ebaysf.com>
Co-Authored-By: Mat Lowery <mlowery@ebaysf.com>
Co-Authored-By: rumale <rumale@ebaysf.com>
Co-Authored-By: Timothy He <the@ebaysf.com>

Partially implements: blueprint clustering

Change-Id: Icab6fc3baab72e97f3231eaa4476b56b8dafb2a3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/75/113675/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
# Copyright 2014 eBay Software Foundation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from trove.cluster.service import ClusterController from trove.common import exception from trove.common import wsgi from trove.common.auth import admin_context from trove.extensions.mgmt.clusters import models from trove.extensions.mgmt.clusters import views from trove.openstack.common import log as logging from trove.openstack.common.gettextutils import _ import trove.common.apischema as apischema LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class ClusterController(ClusterController): """Controller for cluster functionality.""" schemas = apischema.mgmt_cluster @classmethod def get_action_schema(cls, body, action_schema): action_type = body.keys()[0] return action_schema.get(action_type, {}) @admin_context def index(self, req, tenant_id): """Return a list of clusters.""" LOG.debug("Showing a list of clusters for Tenant '%s'" % tenant_id) LOG.info(_("req : '%s'

") % req) context = req.environ[wsgi.CONTEXT_KEY] deleted = None deleted_q = req.GET.get('deleted', '').lower() if deleted_q in ['true']: deleted = True elif deleted_q in ['false']: deleted = False clusters = models.MgmtCluster.load_all(context, deleted=deleted) view_cls = views.MgmtClustersView return wsgi.Result(view_cls(clusters, req=req).data(), 200) @admin_context def show(self, req, tenant_id, id): """Return a single cluster.""" LOG.info(_("req : '%s'

") % req) LOG.info(_("Showing cluster for tenant '%s'") % tenant_id) LOG.info(_("id : '%s'

") % id) context = req.environ[wsgi.CONTEXT_KEY] cluster = models.MgmtCluster.load(context, id) return wsgi.Result( views.load_mgmt_view(cluster, req=req,).data(), 200) @admin_context def action(self, req, body, tenant_id, id): LOG.info(_("req : '%s'

") % req) LOG.info(_("Committing an action against cluster %(cluster)s for " "tenant '%(tenant)s'") % {'cluster': id, 'tenant': tenant_id}) if not body: raise exception.BadRequest(_("Invalid request body.")) context = req.environ[wsgi.CONTEXT_KEY] cluster = models.MgmtCluster.load(context=context, id=id) _actions = { 'reset-task': self._action_reset_task } selected_action = None for key in body: if key in _actions: if selected_action is not None: msg = _("Only one action can be specified per request.") raise exception.BadRequest(msg) selected_action = _actions[key] else: msg = _("Invalid cluster action: %s") % key raise exception.BadRequest(msg) if selected_action: return selected_action(context, cluster, body) else: raise exception.BadRequest(_("Invalid request body.")) def _action_reset_task(self, context, cluster, body): cluster.reset_task() return wsgi.Result(None, 202)

subject: Moved context creation to benchmark.engine
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-04 22:31:30.000000000', 'files': ['tests/benchmark/runners/test_base.py', 'rally/benchmark/runners/base.py', 'tests/orchestrator/test_api.py', 'tests/benchmark/test_engine.py', 'rally/benchmark/scenarios/base.py', 'rally/benchmark/engine.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rally/commit/7c90c69165a23169f613b57be88eef6002848f3d', 'message': "Moved context creation to benchmark.engine

This change makes the architecture of Rally much cleaner.

In addition, getting named meta information from benchmark.

commit_message:
Moved context creation to benchmark.engine

Before this patch, context was created in benchmark.runner
base. This patch moved context creation to benchmark.engine.

This change makes the architecture of Rally much cleaner.
e.g. runners don't know anything about benchmark context
(removing one dependency in code)

In addition, getting named meta information from benchmark.
scenarios.base will return a deepcopy to prevent accidental
changes of the returned object.

Conflicts:
	rally/benchmark/engine.py
	rally/benchmark/runners/base.py
	tests/benchmark/test_engine.py

Change-Id: I5af6edee2815dbddc371c126073474b9aa91d717
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/42/119242/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import copy def _prepare_context(self, context, name, endpoint): scenario_context = base_scenario.Scenario.meta(name, "context") scenario_context.setdefault("users", {}) scenario_context.update(context) context_obj = { "task": self.task, "admin": {"endpoint": endpoint}, "scenario_name": name, "config": scenario_context } return context_obj LOG.info("Running benchmark with key: \n%s" % json.dumps(key, indent=2)) context_obj = self._prepare_context(kw.get("context", {}), name, runner.endpoints[0]) with base_ctx.ContextManager(context_obj): self.duration = runner.run(name, context_obj, kw.get("args", {}))
deleted_lines: LOG.info("Running benchmark with key: %s" % key) self.duration = runner.run( name, kw.get("context", {}), kw.get("args", {}))

commit_message:
Bump pyeclib >= 0.9.5 for Swift Erasure Code project

Swift-EC design is based on the API in pyeclib 0.9.5 currently. It's not
working on < 0.9.5. We should follow the new version.

Change-Id: I257c6c784e1c786f6552c11191c3b4ef2bc8b53e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/86/118986/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pyeclib>=0.9.5 # BSD

commit_message:
Replace explicit assertion for function

In order to reduce the verbosity and repetition when checking the json
schema, there was a function written that does this: It asserts that the
given json input is compliant witht he schema, and throws a proper
exception if possible. Most of the instances of this pattern were
already replaced in the code, but it seems there was one missing (or was
added later). So it was rightly replaced.

Change-Id: Ic9af4ac71c9d91a2083fccd67ca3901859f427e5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/22/118622/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._assert_schema_is_valid(json_data, schema_name)
deleted_lines: try: schema.validate(json_data, self.schema) except schema.ValidationError as e: raise exception.InvalidObject(schema=schema_name, reason=e.message, property=get_invalid_property(e))

commit_message:
collect paramiko logs from tempest runs

This change goes along with a tempest patch [1] which sends paramiko
logs to a file "paramiko.log."

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/118946

Change-Id: I5abcde117f87ae0546099cd9534a0a90ece333fb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/47/118947/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ -f $BASE/new/tempest/paramiko.log ] ; then sudo cp $BASE/new/tempest/paramiko.log $BASE/logs/paramiko.log fi if [ -f $BASE/old/tempest/paramiko.log ] ; then sudo cp $BASE/old/tempest/paramiko.log $BASE/logs/old/paramiko.log fi

commit_message:
send paramiko logs to a file "paramiko.log"

This change adds a WatchedFileHandler for the paramiko logs to be
collected during tempest runs. We have encountered gate bugs [1]
related to SSH public key authentication and the paramiko logs
would be a great help for debugging.

The logs must also be collected by infra in order to be seen,
and the patch for that is here:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/118947

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/grenade/+bug/1349617

Change-Id: I7853fe1aa0c61a43b6de10ff25b18e20ad193e32
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/46/118946/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import logging as orig_loggingfrom oslo.config import cfgCONF = cfg.CONF self._setup_logging() def _setup_logging(self): paramiko_logger = logging.getLogger('paramiko').logger # NOTE(melwitt): paramiko.transport defaults to INFO unlike the # rest of the childs, so set it same as root level = logging.getLogger('').logger.getEffectiveLevel() logging.getLogger('paramiko.transport').logger.setLevel(level) handler = orig_logging.handlers.WatchedFileHandler('paramiko.log') datefmt = CONF.log_date_format handler.setFormatter(logging.ContextFormatter(datefmt=datefmt)) paramiko_logger.addHandler(handler)

commit_message:
Add support for flashing ILO BMC's from ramdisks

This is more than a bit hard to test, requiring as it does an actual
iLO BMC, so sadly I have no tests :(.

HP Hardware really wants to be running latest firmware, and its
commonly agreed that one place where it can be sanely applied is in
the deploy environment, so this is my long threatened implementation
of that.

Change-Id: I3117a250d0d0eb8ee33eb4b15c837485a5cbf476
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/47/107247/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ -d /ilo ]; then find /ilo -type f \( -name flash_ilo3 -o -name flash_ilo4 \) | while read FWNAME do cd /ilo/$(dirname $FWNAME) logname=$(basename $(dirname $FWNAME)) echo Running $FWNAME $SHELL $(basename $FWNAME) --silent --log $logname result=$? echo Finished $FWNAME with result $? cat $logname #avoid leaking space during large runs rm $logname if [ $result -eq 2 ]; then echo "Firmware already up to date" elif [ $result -eq 4 ]; then echo "Firmware not applicable to machine" elif [ $result -ne 0 ]; then echo "Error applying firmware" exit 1 fi done fi

commit_message:
Fix some LOG invocations and messages

LOG.xxx("Hello %s" % xyz) should be LOG.xxx("Hello %s", xyz).
This allows the logging package to skip creating the
formatted log message if the message is not going to be emitted because
of the current log level.

The change touches error, warning and info LOG messages.

Adjust test suite for the above change since LOG now uses two parameters
instead of one.

Fix grammar, add missing "." to log messages in some places.

Change-Id: I86404c34502f07ed6dbda1c82b13db888c60f074

commit_message:
Convert v3 hypervisor plugin to v2.1

This patch convert v3 hypervisor plugin to v2.1 and makes v2
unit tests share between v2 and v2.1.

Unit tests has been modified in optimized way.

The differences between v2 and v3 are described on the wiki page
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/NovaAPIv2tov3.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I23ffc10d4c0170cb43ef8aeebf69ae2794a08827

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock import testtools from openstack.compute.v2 import limits_rate IDENTIFIER = 'IDENTIFIER' EXAMPLE = { 'limit': '1', 'regex': '2', 'uri': '3', } FAKE_RESPONSES = { "limits": { "rate": [ { "limit": "1", "regex": ".*", "uri": "*" }, { "limit": "2", "regex": "^/servers", "uri": "*/servers" }, ] } } class TestLimitsRate(testtools.TestCase): def test_basic(self): sot = limits_rate.LimitsRate() self.assertEqual('limits_rate', sot.resource_key) self.assertEqual('limits_rates', sot.resources_key) self.assertEqual('/limits', sot.base_path) self.assertEqual('compute', sot.service.service_type) self.assertFalse(sot.allow_create) self.assertFalse(sot.allow_retrieve) self.assertFalse(sot.allow_update) self.assertFalse(sot.allow_delete) self.assertTrue(sot.allow_list) def test_make_it(self): sot = limits_rate.LimitsRate(EXAMPLE) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['limit'], sot.limit) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['regex'], sot.regex) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['uri'], sot.uri) def test_list(self): resp = mock.Mock() resp.body = FAKE_RESPONSES sess = mock.Mock() sess.get = mock.MagicMock() sess.get.return_value = resp sot = limits_rate.LimitsRate() resp = sot.list(sess) url = '/limits' sess.get.assert_called_with(url, service=sot.service, params={}) rate = FAKE_RESPONSES['limits']['rate'] cnt = 0 for value in rate: self.assertEqual(value['limit'], resp[cnt].limit) self.assertEqual(value['regex'], resp[cnt].regex) self.assertEqual(value['uri'], resp[cnt].uri) cnt = cnt + 1

commit_message:
Fixes Hyper-V agent issue on Hyper-V 2008 R2

The vmutils.HyperVUtils class used on versions of Hyper-V prior of 2012
is missing the "remove_all_security_rules" method.

Change-Id: Ib14e643c400b230c912589f9480acf59d6e7b147
Closes-Bug: #1360817
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/05/116505/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add support for policy configration directories

This patch add new option 'policy_dirs' and restructure
Enforcer.load_rules to loads policy files from directories that
specified by 'policy_dirs'.

Implement bp policy-configuration-directories

Change-Id: I5218c6fa5f678e1c49b055b7ea351d202ea33e0b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/62/105362/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.CONF.set_override('policy_configration_directories', []) def test_load_directory(self): self.enforcer.load_rules(True) self.assertIsNotNone(self.enforcer.rules) loaded_rules = jsonutils.loads(str(self.enforcer.rules)) self.assertEqual('role:fakeB', loaded_rules['default']) self.assertEqual('is_admin:True', loaded_rules['admin']) def test_load_multiple_directories(self): self.CONF.set_override('policy_configration_directories', ['policy.d', 'policy.2.d']) self.enforcer.load_rules(True) self.assertIsNotNone(self.enforcer.rules) loaded_rules = jsonutils.loads(str(self.enforcer.rules)) self.assertEqual('role:fakeC', loaded_rules['default']) self.assertEqual('is_admin:True', loaded_rules['admin']) def test_load_non_existed_directory(self): self.CONF.set_override('policy_configration_directories', ['policy.d', 'policy.x.d']) self.assertRaises(cfg.ConfigFilesNotFoundError, self.enforcer.load_rules, True) enforcer._get_policy_path, enforcer.policy_file)

commit_message:
Interactive console support for ipminative driver

This patch adds interactive serial console support for ipminative
driver using shellinaboxd and pyghmi. A new class called
NativeIPMIShellinaboxConsole implements the ConsoleInterface.

Closes-Bug: 1359758
Change-Id: I9117c695af40044491fb7f213aa15e841e803d1c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/31/97331/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.console = ipminative.NativeIPMIShellinaboxConsole()

commit_message:
Driver for Fusion-io ioControl Hybrid array

Standard Cinder driver for iSCSI target array.
Uses REST API of the ioControl array.
Implements Quality of Service through the 5 Policies avaliable on the array.
Add Apache License block
Test results: https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1317248

Change-Id: I27fdaedb9f75629a6af625f4e1c7d3f89a8cbb48
Implements: blueprint fusion-io-iocontrol-driver

commit_message:
Add dependency on nova-common to ceilometer agent.

The ceilometer compute agent requires that the 'nova' group
be present. Since nova is no longer handling user and group
installation, some dependency must be established to make sure
basic nova packages are present.

The dependency chain now adds Package['nova-common'] as a
requirement for Packate['ceilometer-common'], which will
ensure that Nova and it's user/group will be created before
the nova group is added to the ceilometer user.

Fixes bug 1350980

Change-Id: I3601cc2be851e607c24a28f935387aa172542b00

The flavor used by Javelin to create servers should not be hard-coded
like the other resources as it is not created and managed by Javelin.
Some test environments require booting test servers using specific

and shoult not allow resources to be specified in its yaml config if
it is not managing them entirely. This instead relies on the flavor_ref

Change-Id: I4f0ba318e5de36764a1a41948b2da43eb03a3b7e

commit_message:
Pull flavor_ref from config for javelin servers

javelin2 provides no facilities for creating/checking/deleting flavors
and shoult not allow resources to be specified in its yaml config if
it is not managing them entirely. This instead relies on the flavor_ref
configured in tempest.conf, which is assumed to be an existent flavor and
functional flavor setup by admin, devstack, etc.

Change-Id: I4f0ba318e5de36764a1a41948b2da43eb03a3b7e

commit_message:
Decouple OS services from boot-stack element

This spec describes required changes to various projects that would decouple
the OpenStack service topology from the central boot-stack element and its
operations.

Change-Id: I2f1a1ff7269877a34ca429e61cd19f83d348391b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-specs refs/changes/85/106885/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =================================================== Remove dependency of services on central boot-stack =================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tripleo/+spec/split-services-from-boot-stack The boot-stack element is central to bootstrapping the infrastructure required for a deployed cloud. This aims to decouple the set of deployed OpenStack services from this bootstrapping and allow greater flexibility in deployment topologies. Problem Description =================== The `boot-stack` element in DIB currently contains a long list of element-deps, including all of the OpenStack services that we currently expect to run on the controller node(s). This element's configure.d script contains code to initialize databases for these services and run database migrations conditionally based on existence of installed binaries (ie, nova-manage). This is problematic: * the `boot-stack` element is a central dependency for these services and makes it impossible to split them from the controller node if a user wishes to isolate certain services to their own node(s). * creation of databases is an infrastructure-level operation that should be separated from database migrations and the code required to run migrations, which is specific to service elements and the versions of code that those elements deploy. Proposed Change =============== * Move the list of deployed OpenStack services from being implied via the element dependencies to being explicitly set during image build, ie by devtest. * Expose this list as a parameter to the heat stack, update devtest to set properly for each layer of the cloud. * Enable the `boot-stack` to initialize databases only for services that are explictly enabled and remove logic from the element that deals with database migrations. * Remove all OpenStack service elements from `boot-stack` element. Alternatives ------------ * As an alternative to using a Heat parameter, we could keep a hard-coded list of possibly deployed services in the templates in the tripleo-heat-templates repository. This would require manual updating everytime a new services introduced and would create databases that may not be used or required. * Keep the list of created databases hard-coded in the boot-stack element as it is today. Similar downsides as above. Security Impact --------------- Minimal. These changes would simply limit the scope of the functionality provided by the `boot-stack` element. If anything, allowing users to isolate public facing services from the database nodes will provide better deployment options in terms of security. Other End User Impact --------------------- Users that deploy using tripleo-image-elements and tripleo-heat-templates but not devtest will be required to pass an additional parameter to their Heat stack that describes the OpenStack services that make up their cloud. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other Deployer Impact --------------------- None Developer Impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: gandelman-a Work Items ---------- * Update Heat templates to accept parameters describing OpenStack services in deployed stack. * Modify devtest scripts to maintain service lists and pass to Heat during stack creation/update. * Update tripleo-image-elements `boot-stack` element to create databases only for enabled services, and remove database migrations. * Remove service elements from element-deps of `boot-stack` element Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Testing of these changes falls within the coverage provided by the current TripleO CI. Documentation Impact ==================== Service list parameter and usaage will be documented as part of devtest's in-line documentation. References ==========

subject: Explicitly set required services in devtest
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-12 00:08:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator/commit/fbf8617378a2d30de16fc3c47329a4a05b446c25', 'message': "Explicitly set required services in devtest

We currently pull in the required OpenStack services for a cloud implicitly
via boot-stack's element-deps in DIB.  Instead, we can state these as explicit
lists in the various stages of devtest. This is a first step toward allowing
services to be split out of the controller nodes and onto their own machines.
Later, we can expose these lists to boot-stack and other components of the
deployment via Heat.

commit_message:
Explicitly set required services in devtest

We currently pull in the required OpenStack services for a cloud implicitly
via boot-stack's element-deps in DIB.  Instead, we can state these as explicit
lists in the various stages of devtest. This is a first step toward allowing
services to be split out of the controller nodes and onto their own machines.
Later, we can expose these lists to boot-stack and other components of the
deployment via Heat.

Change-Id: Ia6b1d344b1d3ee0f226a8b6db0700e79feb0d7e9
Partial-bug: #1340467

commit_message:
Hack in pending upstream eventlet patch DONT MERGE

Pulls in some proposed changes to upstream eventlet into the ironic venv
that work around eventlet+paramiko issues (LP: #1321787) that seem tickled
during stack update/server rebuild.  These changes are (hopefully) slated for
inclusion in eventlet 0.16.  This is meant only to unblock testing.

Change-Id: I894525a681d2b7b3757ebe0d856ba9109c1e3fa4

support provided by the package-installs element.

commit_message:
package-installs for pre-install.d/post-install.d

Packages are often also installed in both the pre-install.d and
post-install.d phases. This patch expands the package-installs element
to support declarative package support for these phases in addition to
the existing support for install.d. The actual install/uninstall logic
is moved to common scripts under bin/ so that it can be reused across
the different phases.

Change-Id: Id51d0bbad232737fc8b5ffaf016dec50cd5b66c9

commit_message:
Use ClusteredComputeManager for Ironic

Ironic ships its own compute manager slightly tailored for deploying
baremetal.  This enables it when VIRT_DRIVER=ironic and helps ensure
we test this as part of Ironic's CI pipeline.

Change-Id: I5fe8d6133cd0bc2585b22a3c353aaa68063b1941

commit_message:
Adds SingleInstanceFilter Nova scheduler filter

This adds a simple SingleInstanceFilter to the Nova scheduler filters.
It ensures a single instance-to-node mapping in the scheduler and does
not allow new instances to be scheduled to nodes that are already hosting
one, regardless of the node's hardware properties and calculated available
resources.

Change-Id: I09c6da387d7d5d53e15e4eeadb49c4b84d596300
Closes-bug: #1301279.

commit_message:
External event callback API

This blueprint adds the support for external OpenStack services to post
callbacks to the Ironic API server on completion of specific events.

Change-Id: I22807de70a0a823582ba1eba8b86b25c20bca99f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/70/99770/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== External Event Callback API ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/event-callback-api This blueprint adds the support for external OpenStack services to post callbacks to the Ironic API server on completion of specific events. Problem description =================== Ironic currently has no way of coordinating with external services to synchronize on the initiation or completion of external events. This currently presents issues in the PXE driver around the coordination between Neutron and Ironic, as described in bug #1300589 [1]. This will likely become more critical in other areas as new drivers and other areas of Ironic rely more on facilities provided by external services. The proposed reference agent driver [2] dynamically removes and adds Neutron networks to nodes and faces similar races to those that currently affect port updates. Proposed change =============== During the Icehouse cycle, Nova faced similar issues around instance VIF plugging and Neutron port modification. Their solution was to implement a new admin-level `os-external-event` REST API [3] that external services can use to post callbacks that events have completed. A lightweight notification system was added to Neutron to utilize the endpoint via functionality added to python-novaclient. This blueprint proposes adding similar functionality to Ironic at the API-level and creating a mechanism for conductor nodes to register events that they will be blocking on. As event and status updates are received at the API server, RPC calls will be sent to relevant conductors allowing blocking calls to wake and continue. Alternatives ------------ Alternatives to REST-based callbacks include: * Subscribing to RPC-based event notifications that are already broadcast by Neutron. However, this would make us dependent on an loosely defined interface that may change without warning. * Zookeeper, PubSubHubbub, webhooks or other tools to handle coordinated event synchronization but would require integration, new infrastructure and convincing other projects to adopt. This is not feasible at this time for a number of reasons. Data model impact ----------------- A new versioned `ExternalEvent` IronicObject will be created to represent an individual external event with attributes such as: uuid, instance_uuid, name, status, tag. A similar database object and table will be created to ensure persistence of external event subscriptions in the event that conductor service is restarted while waiting for event completion. REST API impact --------------- External services configured to do so will post a JSON blob to the defined endpoint containing a list of external events. ironic-api will determine which conductor is responsible for the instance described in each event and send RPC notification of event completion. * Specification for the method * Description: External services may post data about external events associated with specific instances. * Method type: POST * Normal http response code(s): 200 * Expected error http response code(s): * 200: All external events in the request were successful processed. * 207: Some external events in the request were processed but others were not because associated instances could not be found. * 404: None of the external events in the request were processsed because associated instances could not be found. * URL: /{api version}/os-external-event/ * Parameters: None * JSON schema definition for the body data: A JSON dict with a list of dicts contained at the `events` key. Each event in the list contains the following keys: * name: The name of the event. * instance_uuid: The uuid of the instance the event pertains to. * status: The status of the event. * tags: Arbitary metadata about specific event, i.e. the uuid of a created network during event completion. { "events": [ { "name": {...}, "instance_uuid": {...}, "status": {...}, "tag": {...}, }, { "name": {...}, "instance_uuid": {...}, "status": {...}, "tag": {...}, } } * JSON schema definition for the response data: A JSON dict that returns the events that were posted, with an added `code` key that describes the status of processing that invididual event. { "events": [ { "code": {...}, "name": {...}, "instance_uuid": {...}, "status": {...}, "tag": {...}, }, { "code": {...}, "name": {...}, "instance_uuid": {...}, "status": {...}, "tag": {...}, } } * Example use case: * Request Notify Ironic that two Neutron ports have been attached for two separate instances. URL: /<api version>/os-external-events/ Method Type: POST Body: { "events": [ { "name": "neutron-port-plugged", "instance_uuid": "6f813178-f107-11e3-9215-ab71859035eb", "status": "completed", "tag": "port_id:7aac2e0e-f107-11e3-a7ad-7fc48efea4c3", }, { "name": "neutron-port-plugged", "instance_uuid": "b1b108c0-f107-11e3-ab49-efabd0e3196d", "status": "completed", "tag": "port_id:c93af316-f107-11e3-b01b-73c2635b72ef", }, } * Response One event succeeded in being processed, the other failed: Response code: 217 { "events": [ { "code": "200", "name": "neutron-port-plugged", "instance_uuid": "6f813178-f107-11e3-9215-ab71859035eb", "status": "completed", "tag": "port_id:7aac2e0e-f107-11e3-a7ad-7fc48efea4c3", }, { "code": "404", "name": "neutron-network-attached", "instance_uuid": "b1b108c0-f107-11e3-ab49-efabd0e3196d", "status": "completed", "tag": "net_id:c93af316-f107-11e3-b01b-73c2635b72ef", }, } Driver API impact ----------------- The facilities that can be used to create external events and wait for their completion will be general purpose and available as core functionality to any driver that requires such synchronization. The first consumer will be the PXE SSH driver which is currently stressed as part of the Ironic and TripleO gates. Nova driver impact ------------------ None. This affects the API and Conductor services only. Security impact --------------- Requests to this new API endpoint will be admin-level and managed using the standard mechanisms provided by Keystone and RBAC defined in Ironic's policy.json. Other end user impact --------------------- End users will have no visisble impact as this is a service-level API. Scalability impact ------------------ Events will require API communication between Ironic and external services. Performance Impact ------------------ This will slightly increase the provisioning time of the pxe_ssh driver, which is the only current place this would be utilized. The impact of future uses of this feature is TBD. Other deployer impact --------------------- Deployers will be required to ensure open communication between external services and the Ironic API endpoint to ensure event notifications can be posted. Developer impact ---------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- XXX Work Items ---------- XXX Dependencies ============ This will be dependent on new features that will be added to python-ironicclient allowing events to be posted to the API server. Once implemented, external services (i.e., Neutron) will need to be updated with features that send notifications to Ironic via python-ironicclient. Neutron has a `neutron.notifications` module that could easily be extended. Testing ======= This will initially become part of standard provisioning for the pxe_ssh driver and as such will be stressed as part of the current DevStack Ironic jobs in the gate. Documentation Impact ==================== Deployer documentation should be updated to address any configuration requried for external services to enable event callbacks to Ironic.a Nova References ========== [1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1300589/comments/1 [2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/90233/ [3] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Nova/ExternalEventAPI

commit_message:
Makes kombu_ssl_* parameters optional when rabbit_use_ssl => true

The kombu_ssl_* parameters should not be required when rabbit_use_ssl => true
Rather, rabbit_use_ssl must be set to true if the kombu_ssl_* parameters are
used.

Change-Id: I3ce6a1a271efc560fedce9456489f5bc98ca00b9
Closes-Bug: 1356083
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceilometer refs/changes/87/119187/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: context "with SSL enabled with kombu" do context "with SSL enabled without kombu" do :rabbit_use_ssl => 'true' it { should contain_ceilometer_config('DEFAULT/rabbit_use_ssl').with_value('true') } it { should contain_ceilometer_config('DEFAULT/kombu_ssl_ca_certs').with_ensure('absent') } it { should contain_ceilometer_config('DEFAULT/kombu_ssl_certfile').with_ensure('absent') } it { should contain_ceilometer_config('DEFAULT/kombu_ssl_keyfile').with_ensure('absent') } it { should contain_ceilometer_config('DEFAULT/kombu_ssl_version').with_value('SSLv3') } end context "with SSL wrongly configured" do context 'with kombu_ssl_ca_certs parameter' do before { params.merge!(:kombu_ssl_ca_certs => '/path/to/ca.crt') } it_raises 'a Puppet::Error', /The kombu_ssl_ca_certs parameter requires rabbit_use_ssl to be set to true/ end context 'with kombu_ssl_certfile parameter' do before { params.merge!(:kombu_ssl_certfile => '/path/to/ssl/cert/file') } it_raises 'a Puppet::Error', /The kombu_ssl_certfile parameter requires rabbit_use_ssl to be set to true/ end context 'with kombu_ssl_keyfile parameter' do before { params.merge!(:kombu_ssl_keyfile => '/path/to/ssl/keyfile') } it_raises 'a Puppet::Error', /The kombu_ssl_keyfile parameter requires rabbit_use_ssl to be set to true/ end
deleted_lines: context "with SSL enabled" do context "with SSL wrongly configured" do :rabbit_use_ssl => 'false', :kombu_ssl_certfile => '/path/to/cert.crt', :kombu_ssl_keyfile => '/path/to/cert.key', :kombu_ssl_version => 'TLSv1' it_raises 'a Puppet::Error', /The kombu_ssl_ca_certs parameter is required when rabbit_use_ssl is set to true/

commit_message:
Add the qa spec for bp:add-icehouse-swift-tests

Add the spec which describes why and how to add test cases of Swift functions
introduced in icehouse version.

Partially implements blueprint add-icehouse-swift-tests
Change-Id: I8ed2b8f05dd024246e534dd1ed6bd8b35e91a222
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/qa-specs refs/changes/20/105120/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. ================================ Add Swift API Tests for Icehouse ================================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tempest/+spec/add-icehouse-swift-tests Add Swift API tests which are added in Icehouse release (version 1.13.1) Problem description =================== Between Havana and Icehouse releases, some new features are added in Swift. However, Tempest currently has only subset of API tests of those features. Proposed change =============== Add API tests for following new functions. - New-style container synchronization - Getting contents inline by TempURL - POST request to delete multiple containers and objects in bulk New file test_container_sync_middleware.py will be created to include tests of new container synchronization. Test cases for other two features are added in existing appropriate files. In new container sync feature, 'realm' and 'cluster' names are used in "X-Container-Sync-To" header like //<realm_name>/<cluster_name>/<account>/<container> to specify where to synchronize objects as substitute for URL which is used in old-style container sync. Realm and cluster names are defined in Swift's container-sync-realms.conf, therefore it is also necessary to specify realm and cluster names in tempest.conf. Following two config values must be added:: [object-storage] realm_name=<realm name> cluster_name=<cluster name> Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Daisuke Morita <morita.daisuke@lab.ntt.co.jp> Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Juno-3 Work Items ---------- - Write test cases for Swift's new functions - Add config values to run tests of new-style container sync

Convert server_usage v3 plugin to v2.1 API

Changes required to have v3 plugin natively support the V2.1
API.

commit_message:
stop locking skipping of busy instances during _sync_power_states

This change moves the logic for skipping instances with pending tasks
during a _sync_power_states call outside of the lock as it can cause
other periodic tasks to get backed up behind it.

It seems safe not to lock around the task_state check for a skip
because the instance object was read before the locking and isn't
being refreshed anyway.

Closes-Bug: #1362194
Change-Id: Ia2c4603da66ccd5ae511ebf87b32a09cebe81aaa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/39/117639/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._skip_pending_task_or_sync_power_state(context, db_instance) def _skip_pending_task_or_sync_power_state(self, context, db_instance): # NOTE(melwitt): This can be outside the lock because the instance # object isn't being refreshed and syncing the skip # can hang up periodic tasks behind busy instances {'task': db_instance.task_state}, instance=db_instance) continue # NOTE(melwitt): This must be synchronized as we query state from # two separate sources, the driver and the database. # They are set (in stop_instance) and read, in sync. @utils.synchronized(db_instance.uuid) def query_driver_power_state_and_sync(): self._query_driver_power_state_and_sync(context, db_instance) try: query_driver_power_state_and_sync() except Exception: LOG.exception(_LE("Periodic sync_power_state task had an " "error while processing an instance."), instance=db_instance) def _query_driver_power_state_and_sync(self, context, db_instance):
deleted_lines: # NOTE(melwitt): This must be synchronized as we query state from # two separate sources, the driver and the database. # They are set (in stop_instance) and read, in sync. @utils.synchronized(db_instance.uuid) def query_driver_power_state_and_sync(): self._query_driver_power_state_and_sync(context, db_instance) try: query_driver_power_state_and_sync() except Exception: LOG.exception(_LE("Periodic sync_power_state task had an " "error while processing an instance."), instance=db_instance) def _query_driver_power_state_and_sync(self, context, db_instance): {'task': db_instance.task_state}, instance=db_instance) return

subject: Mask passwords in exceptions and error messages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-02 19:48:42.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_processutils.py', 'openstack/common/processutils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator/commit/6a60f84258c2be3391541dbe02e30b8e836f6c22', 'message': 'Mask passwords in exceptions and error messages

When a ProcessExecutionError is thrown by processutils.ssh_execute(),
the exception may contain information such as password. Upstream
applications that just log the message (as several appear to do) could
inadvertently expose these passwords to a user with read access to the
log files. It is therefore considered prudent to invoke
strutils.mask_password() on the command, stdout and stderr in the
exception. A test case has been added to ensure that all three are
properly masked.

An earlier commit (I173dfb865e84eb7dee54a22c76db1e4f125a0a8a) failed
to address ssh_execute(). This change set addresses ssh_execute.

Submitted to oslo.concurrency in
I0db9e98cbeb2a5e6f9ae0074f24717aa91cfc238

OSSA is aware of this change request.

Change-Id: Ie0caf32469126dd9feb44867adf27acb6e383958
Closes-Bug: #1343604
'}]
commit_message:
Mask passwords in exceptions and error messages

When a ProcessExecutionError is thrown by processutils.ssh_execute(),
the exception may contain information such as password. Upstream
applications that just log the message (as several appear to do) could
inadvertently expose these passwords to a user with read access to the
log files. It is therefore considered prudent to invoke
strutils.mask_password() on the command, stdout and stderr in the
exception. A test case has been added to ensure that all three are
properly masked.

An earlier commit (I173dfb865e84eb7dee54a22c76db1e4f125a0a8a) failed
to address ssh_execute(). This change set addresses ssh_execute.

Submitted to oslo.concurrency in
I0db9e98cbeb2a5e6f9ae0074f24717aa91cfc238

OSSA is aware of this change request.

Change-Id: Ie0caf32469126dd9feb44867adf27acb6e383958
Closes-Bug: #1343604
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/52/118452/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sanitized_cmd = strutils.mask_password(cmd) LOG.debug('Running cmd (SSH): %s', sanitized_cmd) sanitized_stdout = strutils.mask_password(stdout) sanitized_stderr = strutils.mask_password(stderr) stdout=sanitized_stdout, stderr=sanitized_stderr, cmd=sanitized_cmd) return (sanitized_stdout, sanitized_stderr)
deleted_lines: LOG.debug('Running cmd (SSH): %s', cmd) stdout=stdout, stderr=stderr, cmd=cmd) return (stdout, stderr)

commit_message:
Replace @mirantis.com in OpenStack service users

Murano, Sahara and Heat would deploy with usernames
including @mirantis.com email addresses.  These
were replaced witih @example.com.

Change-Id: Ic3fd9fe60fadffe22dfb22d3a3afef09eaf86f61
Closes-bug: 1362173

subject: Make ssh-host-key-policy configurable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-14 20:32:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/4246a5d548b6f5bd156e7fda40b0b0e3df74d1be', 'message': "Make ssh-host-key-policy configurable

This patch adds configuration options for ssh_hosts_key_file and
strict_ssh_host_key_policy.  You can set strict_ssh_host_key_policy
to 'True' or 'False'.  If set to false the first connection of a host
will cause it to be added to the known_hosts file.  Subsequent connections
will be enforced against the existing key.  Changes in the key are assumed
to be a Man-in-the-Middle attack so the connection is rejected.

If strict_ssh_host_key_policy is 'True' the key for the host that is
being connected to must be in the hosts_key_file.  No first connection
assumptions are made.

strict_ssh_host_key_policy is set to 'False' to keep functionality similar
to the existing functionality.

With this patch, a default of ~cinder/.ssh/known_hosts is used for the
known_hosts file.  Unlike the previous approach, this now requires the
user to have a known_hosts file that is writable, somewhere.  The option
is configurable if they don't want to use ~cinder/.ssh/

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ia7a747224dbb08528f3c7a51da4cd4a6bf0eac1c
Implements-blueprint: configurable-ssh-host-key-policy

commit_message:
Make ssh-host-key-policy configurable

This patch adds configuration options for ssh_hosts_key_file and
strict_ssh_host_key_policy.  You can set strict_ssh_host_key_policy
to 'True' or 'False'.  If set to false the first connection of a host
will cause it to be added to the known_hosts file.  Subsequent connections
will be enforced against the existing key.  Changes in the key are assumed
to be a Man-in-the-Middle attack so the connection is rejected.

If strict_ssh_host_key_policy is 'True' the key for the host that is
being connected to must be in the hosts_key_file.  No first connection
assumptions are made.

strict_ssh_host_key_policy is set to 'False' to keep functionality similar
to the existing functionality.

With this patch, a default of $state_path/ssh_known_hosts is used for the
known_hosts file.  Unlike the previous approach, this now requires the
user to have a known_hosts file that is writable, somewhere.  The option
is configurable if they don't want to use $state_path/ssh_known_hosts

DocImpact:  Need to document the new strict_ssh_host_key_policy as well
as the ssh_hosts_key_file.  A note should be made for drivers that may
pass a hosts_key_file via kwargs when creating an ssh pool: their file
will be loaded along with the file configured via /etc/cinder.conf.
Also worth noting, for development environments, an ssh_hosts_key_file of
/dev/null and a strict_ssh_host_key_policy setting of 'False' may be used.
Using those setting will ignore these changes.

Change-Id: Ia7a747224dbb08528f3c7a51da4cd4a6bf0eac1c
Implements-blueprint: configurable-ssh-host-key-policy
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/36/114336/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo.config import cfg ssh_opts = [ cfg.BoolOpt('strict_ssh_host_key_policy', default=False, help='Option to enable strict host key checking. When ' 'set to "True" Cinder will only connect to systems ' 'with a host key present in the configured ' '"ssh_hosts_key_file". When set to "False" the host key ' 'will be saved upon first connection and used for ' 'subsequent connections. OPTIONAL: Default=False'), cfg.StrOpt('ssh_hosts_key_file', default='/home/cinder/.ssh/known_hosts', help='File containing SSH host keys for the systems with which ' 'Cinder needs to communicate. OPTIONAL: ' 'Default=/home/cinder/.ssh/known_hosts'), ] CONF = cfg.CONF CONF.register_opts(ssh_opts) #self.missing_key_policy = kwargs.pop('missing_key_policy') LOG.warning(_("Passing missing_key_policy at pool creation time " "is deprecated. Set strict_ssky_host_key_policy " "via cinder.conf")) # Validate good config setting here. # Paramiko handles the case where the file is inaccessible. if not CONF.ssh_hosts_key_file: msg = _("ssh_hosts_key_file is not set.") raise exception.InvalidInput(reason=msg) elif not os.path.isfile(CONF.ssh_hosts_key_file): msg = (_("Unable to find ssh_hosts_key_file: %s") % CONF.ssh_hosts_key_file) raise exception.InvalidInput(reason=msg) #if 'hosts_key_file' in kwargs.keys(): # key_file = kwargs.pop('hosts_key_file') # if key_file: # self.hosts_key_file.append(key_file) # LOG.debug(("Adding adding additional hosts_key_file: %s") % # self.hosts_key_file_kwargs) LOG.debug("Setting strict_ssh_host_key_policy to '%(policy)s' " "using ssh_hosts_key_file '%(key_file)s'." % {'policy': CONF.strict_ssh_host_key_policy, 'key_file': CONF.ssh_hosts_key_file}) self.strict_ssh_host_key_policy = CONF.strict_ssh_host_key_policy self.hosts_key_file = CONF.ssh_hosts_key_file # If we can't find the host in our host_keys_file and we have # strict checking configured, we need to throw an error. Otherwise # assume this is the first time connecting and auto add. #ssh.set_missing_host_key_policy(self.missing_key_policy) #for key_file in self.hosts_key_file: # LOG.debug("Loading key file: %s") % key_file ssh.load_host_keys(self.hosts_key_file) host_keys = ssh.get_host_keys() if self.ip not in host_keys: if self.strict_ssh_host_key_policy: msg = (_("Host '%(host)s' not found in hosts_key_file " "'%(key_file)s' and strict_ssh_host_key_policy " "is configured. Unable to connect!") % {'host': self.ip, 'key_file': self.hosts_key_file}) raise exception.CinderException(msg) else: LOG.debug("Found host '%(ip)s' for the first time. Auto " "adding to hosts key file '%(key_file)s'..." % {'ip': self.ip, 'key_file': self.hosts_key_file}) ssh.set_missing_host_key_policy(paramiko.AutoAddPolicy())
deleted_lines: self.missing_key_policy = kwargs.pop('missing_key_policy') else: self.missing_key_policy = paramiko.AutoAddPolicy() if 'hosts_key_file' in kwargs.keys(): self.hosts_key_file = kwargs.pop('hosts_key_file') else: self.hosts_key_file = None ssh.set_missing_host_key_policy(self.missing_key_policy) if not self.hosts_key_file: ssh.load_system_host_keys() else: ssh.load_host_keys(self.hosts_key_file)

commit_message:
Nova review updates for _node_resource

In review https://review.openstack.org/#/c/111425/14 it has been
raised that if the cpu_arch is not set, we should be using Nova
helper functions instead of 'NotFound'.  Also we should be
canonicalizing the user provided config value.

Once this is approved and merged, it will be proposed back into
the Nova tree.

Change-Id: Idfe0730daa22c6550a1a15b45f481635d2eb5195

commit_message:
Refactor object PUT to make EC easier to add

EC fragment archives need to go on the right primary nodes; that is,
fragment archive 0 needs to go on primary node 0, 1 on 1, and so
forth. Handoff nodes, however, are unordered.

This commit plumbs the index through to the proxy ObjectController's
PUT method as well as adds a (very simple) transform for replicated
data storage. Hopefully, this provides an easy integration point for
EC to use.

Change-Id: I72e6f313b12d7d4611fd95109ba66c8df8c8fa0f
