commit_message:
MLNX Agent: ensure removed ports get treated on resyncs

This patch ensures that removed ports will be cleaned up properly if exception
occurs in the daemon_loop.
It does the same for the mlnx-agent as was done for the lb-agent in
Ieada34ad315c0c29aa8462ebf041a448fde007b8.

Refactoring the daemon_loop and scan_ports in a way that -
If there's an exception, the ports that were flagged for cleaning will
be retreated in the following iteration,
unlike previous exception handling, where only existing ports
were treated in the following iteration.

Closes-Bug: 1287648
Change-Id: I3af505773aa3fdc0d17f2079ac1f1b3e93bb64a3
Signed-off-by: Roey Chen <roeyc@mellanox.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/88/94888/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def scan_ports(self, previous, sync): if sync: # Either it's the first iteration or previous iteration had # problems. port_info['added'] = cur_ports port_info['removed'] = ((previous['removed'] | previous['current']) - cur_ports) port_info['updated'] = ((previous['updated'] | updated_ports) & cur_ports) else: # Shouldn't process updates for not existing ports port_info['added'] = cur_ports - previous['current'] port_info['removed'] = previous['current'] - cur_ports port_info['updated'] = updated_ports & cur_ports sync = True port_info = {'current': set(), 'added': set(), 'removed': set(), 'updated': set()} try: port_info = self.scan_ports(previous=port_info, sync=sync) if sync: LOG.info(_("Agent out of sync with plugin!")) sync = False # notify plugin about port deltas LOG.debug(_("Agent loop process devices!")) # If treat devices fails - must resync with plugin if self._port_info_has_changes(port_info): LOG.debug(_("Starting to process devices in:%s"), port_info) try: sync = self.process_network_ports(port_info) except Exception: LOG.exception(_("Error in agent event loop")) sync = True
deleted_lines: def scan_ports(self, registered_ports): # Shouldn't process updates for not existing ports port_info['updated'] = updated_ports & cur_ports port_info['added'] = cur_ports - registered_ports port_info['removed'] = registered_ports - cur_ports sync = True ports = set() if sync: LOG.info(_("Agent out of sync with plugin!")) ports.clear() sync = False try: port_info = self.scan_ports(ports) # notify plugin about port deltas LOG.debug(_("Agent loop process devices!")) # If treat devices fails - must resync with plugin ports = port_info['current'] if self._port_info_has_changes(port_info): LOG.debug(_("Starting to process devices in:%s"), port_info) sync = self.process_network_ports(port_info) except Exception: LOG.exception(_("Error in agent event loop")) sync = True # Put the pors back in self.updated_ports self.updated_ports |= updated_ports

subject: MLNX Agent: Process port_update notifications in the main agent loop
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-22 14:24:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/fcf71f379b51cc6aab0401faa9f32ffdfcc79841', 'message': 'MLNX Agent: Process port_update notifications in the main agent loop

Closes-Bug: #1279655
Change-Id: I63dda60cb3cf171e5e9111a1ecf95e45e1d86362
Signed-off-by: Roey Chen <roeyc@mellanox.com>
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-05-22 14:25:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/12a87bc0f255412aa43fbdc21ce384d89adca396', 'message': 'MLNX Agent: Process port_update notifications in the main agent loop

Closes-Bug: #1279655
Change-Id: I63dda60cb3cf171e5e9111a1ecf95e45e1d86362
Signed-off-by: Roey Chen <roeyc@mellanox.com>
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-06-01 13:37:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/e738de64c2afa22e6bc489e3412cc2d228a6c949', 'message': 'MLNX Agent: Process port_update notifications in the main agent loop

This patch changes the way mlnx agent process port_update notifications.
It does the same for the mlnx agent as was done for the ovs-agent in
I219c6bdf63b0b5e945b655677f9e28fa591f03cd.
Processing a port_update notification directly in the RPC
call may cause competition with the main RPC loop.
To prevent this problem, the actual process of ports updates is done
in the main RPC loop, whereas the RPC call merely adds the updated
port MAC address to a set of updated ports.
port_update notifications received within a single main loop iteration
will be coalesced and processed only once.

Closes-Bug: 1279655
Change-Id: I63dda60cb3cf171e5e9111a1ecf95e45e1d86362
Signed-off-by: Roey Chen <roeyc@mellanox.com>

commit_message:
MLNX Agent: Process port_update notifications in the main agent loop

This patch changes the way mlnx agent process port_update notifications.
It does the same for the mlnx agent as was done for the ovs-agent in
I219c6bdf63b0b5e945b655677f9e28fa591f03cd.
Processing a port_update notification directly in the RPC
call may cause competition with the main RPC loop.
To prevent this problem, the actual process of ports updates is done
in the main RPC loop, whereas the RPC call merely adds the updated
port MAC address to a set of updated ports.
port_update notifications received within a single main loop iteration
will be coalesced and processed only once.

Closes-Bug: 1279655
Change-Id: I63dda60cb3cf171e5e9111a1ecf95e45e1d86362
Signed-off-by: Roey Chen <roeyc@mellanox.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/82/94882/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.agent.add_port_update(port['mac_address']) LOG.debug(_("port_update message processed for port with mac %s"), port['mac_address']) # Stores port update notifications for processing in main rpc loop self.updated_ports = set() def add_port_update(self, port): self.updated_ports.add(port) def scan_ports(self, registered_ports): cur_ports = self.eswitch.get_vnics_mac() port_info = {'current': cur_ports} updated_ports = self.updated_ports self.updated_ports = set() # Shouldn't process updates for not existing ports port_info['updated'] = updated_ports & cur_ports port_info['added'] = cur_ports - registered_ports port_info['removed'] = registered_ports - cur_ports return port_info if 'security_groups' in port_info and port_info.get('updated'): self.refresh_firewall() device_added_updated = port_info['added'] | port_info['updated'] if device_added_updated: start = time.time() resync_a = self.treat_devices_added_or_updated(device_added_updated) LOG.debug(_("process_network_ports - treat_device_added_or_updated " "completed in %.3f"), time.time() - start) if port_info['removed']: start = time.time() LOG.debug(_("process_network_ports - treat_device_removed " "completed in %.3f"), time.time() - start) def treat_devices_added_or_updated(self, devices): LOG.debug(_("Setting status for %s to UP"), device) self.plugin_rpc.update_device_up( self.context, device, self.agent_id, cfg.CONF.host) else: LOG.debug(_("Setting status for %s to DOWN"), device) self.plugin_rpc.update_device_down( self.context, device, self.agent_id, cfg.CONF.host) def _port_info_has_changes(self, port_info): return (port_info['added'] or port_info['removed'] or port_info['updated']) start = time.time() if sync: LOG.info(_("Agent out of sync with plugin!")) ports.clear() sync = False try: port_info = self.scan_ports(ports) LOG.debug(_("Agent loop process devices!")) # If treat devices fails - must resync with plugin ports = port_info['current'] if self._port_info_has_changes(port_info): LOG.debug(_("Starting to process devices in:%s"), port_info) # Put the pors back in self.updated_ports self.updated_ports |= updated_ports

commit_message:
Refactor plugin setup helpers out of test.base

Helper methods for plugin and notification setup were previously
defined on neutron.tests.base.BaseTestCase.  The imports required to
support these helpers were preventing the api tests from consuming
tempest due to configuration conflicts that resulted between neutron
and tempest.  This change moves the helpers to a new module in
tests/unit so that BaseTestCase can be safely used across all types of
tests.

Partially-Implements: blueprint retargetable-functional-testing

Change-Id: I44251db399cd73390a9d1931a7f253662002ba10

commit_message:
InstanceNUMAToplogy object create remove uuid param

We can get this from the object attribute so no need to pass it in
explicitly.

We do not need to bump the version of the object as there is no code
calling it as of yet, so we do not have to support the broken method
interface until the next major version bump.

Change-Id: I96e1d958e907272d94d7ca6481592b79ea6b6397
Blueprint: virt-driver-numa-placement

commit_message:
Make location of saved credentials files customizable

Save undercloud/overcloud-passwords in $TRIPLEO_ROOT by default.
User can also specify the path by changing the parameters in
devtest_variables.

Change-Id: Ifca80a1d9bc9aff61aee8c70e67f59451d1bb55b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/57/97657/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ -e $TRIPLEO_ROOT/tripleo-overcloud-passwords ]; then echo "Re-using existing passwords in $TRIPLEO_ROOT/tripleo-overcloud-passwords" source $TRIPLEO_ROOT/tripleo-overcloud-passwords
deleted_lines: if [ -e tripleo-overcloud-passwords ]; then echo "Re-using existing passwords in $PWD/tripleo-overcloud-passwords" # Add any new passwords since the file was generated setup-overcloud-passwords tripleo-overcloud-passwords source tripleo-overcloud-passwords

commit_message:
virt: setup TCP chardevice in libvirt driver

Setup the tcp chardevice in the libvirt driver based on the
configuration (if the serial consoles are enabled) and disable the
logging to a file since we have an interactive console.

A new image property is introduced: hw_serial_port_count
A new flavor extra spec is introduced: hw:serial_port_count

Co-Authored-By: Vladan Popovic <vpopovic@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ian Wells <iawells@cisco.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sushma Korati <sushma_korati@persistent.co.in>

DocImpact
Partial-Implements: blueprint serial-ports
Change-Id: Ic6d24e27d61f600a90ed8fccb525d8b82725903e

self.assertEqual(len(cfg.devices), 7) self.assertIsInstance(cfg.devices[0], vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuestDisk) self.assertIsInstance(cfg.devices[1], vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuestDisk) self.assertIsInstance(cfg.devices[2], vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuestSerial) self.assertIsInstance(cfg.devices[3], vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuestSerial) self.assertIsInstance(cfg.devices[4], libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver(fake.FakeVirtAPI(), True) instance_ref = db.instance_create(self.context, self.test_instance) disk_info = blockinfo.get_disk_info(CONF.libvirt.virt_type, instance_ref) image_meta = {"properties": {"serial": "3"}} cfg = conn._get_guest_config(instance_ref, [], image_meta, disk_info) self.assertEqual(len(cfg.devices), 9) self.assertIsInstance(cfg.devices[0], vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuestDisk) self.assertIsInstance(cfg.devices[1], vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuestDisk) self.assertIsInstance(cfg.devices[2], vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuestSerial) "tcp") def test_get_guest_config_serial_console_through_invalid_img_meta(self): self.flags(enabled=True, group='serial_console') conn = libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver(fake.FakeVirtAPI(), True) instance_ref = db.instance_create(self.context, self.test_instance) disk_info = blockinfo.get_disk_info(CONF.libvirt.virt_type, instance_ref) image_meta = {"properties": {"serial": "fail"}} cfg = conn._get_guest_config(instance_ref, [], image_meta, disk_info) self.assertEqual(len(cfg.devices), 7) self.assertIsInstance(cfg.devices[0], vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuestDisk) self.assertIsInstance(cfg.devices[1], vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuestDisk) self.assertIsInstance(cfg.devices[2], vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuestSerial) self.assertIsInstance(cfg.devices[3], vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuestSerial) self.assertIsInstance(cfg.devices[4], vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuestInput) self.assertIsInstance(cfg.devices[5], vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuestGraphics) self.assertIsInstance(cfg.devices[6], vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuestVideo) self.assertEqual(cfg.devices[2].type, "tcp") def test_get_serial_console(self): self.flags(enabled=True, group="serial_console") instance = self.create_instance_obj(self.context) dummyxml = ("<domain type='qemu'>" "<name>instance-0000000a</name>" "<devices><serial type='tcp'>" "<source host='127.0.0.1' mode='bind' service='10000'/>" "<target port='0'/>" "</serial></devices></domain>") vdmock = self.mox.CreateMock(libvirt.virDomain) self.mox.StubOutWithMock(vdmock, "XMLDesc") vdmock.XMLDesc(0).AndReturn(dummyxml) def fake_lookup(instance_name): if instance_name == instance.name: return vdmock self.create_fake_libvirt_mock(lookupByName=fake_lookup) self.mox.ReplayAll() conn = libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver(fake.FakeVirtAPI(), False) serial_dict = conn.get_serial_console(self.context, instance) self.assertEqual(serial_dict['port'], '10000') def test_get_serial_console_unavailable(self): self.flags(enabled=True, group="serial_console") instance = self.create_instance_obj(self.context) dummyxml = ("<domain type='qemu'>" "<name>instance-0000000a</name>" "<devices><serial type='tcp'>" "</serial></devices></domain>") vdmock = self.mox.CreateMock(libvirt.virDomain) self.mox.StubOutWithMock(vdmock, "XMLDesc") vdmock.XMLDesc(0).AndReturn(dummyxml) def fake_lookup(instance_name): if instance_name == instance.name: return vdmock self.create_fake_libvirt_mock(lookupByName=fake_lookup) self.mox.ReplayAll() conn = libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver(fake.FakeVirtAPI(), False) self.assertRaises(exception.ConsoleTypeUnavailable, conn.get_serial_console, self.context, instance)

commit_message:
OFAgent: Avoid processing ports which are not yet ready

Port the following patch to OFAgent.
commit: 2702baed390d094b0eac07d0ae167ed236868d00
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/65838/

Closes-Bug: 1307745

Change-Id: Ie1fe0944fb541ba45ffb5b03747d5da289cede51
(cherry picked from commit b7a753ce80d34f7d98c4b401e364b5f6a740c3f4)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/79/102079/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: with contextlib.nested( mock.patch.object(self.agent.plugin_rpc, 'get_device_details', side_effect=Exception()), mock.patch.object(self.agent.int_br, 'get_vif_port_by_id', return_value=mock.Mock())): def test_treat_devices_added_does_not_process_missing_port(self): with contextlib.nested( mock.patch.object(self.agent.plugin_rpc, 'get_device_details'), mock.patch.object(self.agent.int_br, 'get_vif_port_by_id', return_value=None) ) as (get_dev_fn, get_vif_func): self.assertFalse(get_dev_fn.called)

commit_message:
Change v3 version API to v2.1

This patch changes v3 version API to v2.1 and makes v2 unit tests
share between v2 and v2.1.
v2.1 API does not support XML format. Unit tests related to XML
don't work against v2.1.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I7abadb0c9082b9e90a98938967f0e27d1a2fa766

"media-types": [ { "base": "application/json", "type": "application/vnd.openstack.compute+json;version=3", } ], } } class VersionsTest(test.NoDBTestCase): def test_get_version_list_302(self): req = webob.Request.blank('/v3') req.accept = "application/json" res = req.get_response(fakes.wsgi_app_v3()) self.assertEqual(res.status_int, 302) redirect_req = webob.Request.blank('/v3/') self.assertEqual(res.location, redirect_req.url) def test_get_version_3_detail(self): req = webob.Request.blank('/v3/') req.accept = "application/json" res = req.get_response(fakes.wsgi_app_v3()) self.assertEqual(res.status_int, 200) self.assertEqual(res.content_type, "application/json") version = jsonutils.loads(res.body) expected = {"version": EXP_VERSIONS['v2.0']} self.assertEqual(expected, version) def test_get_version_3_versions_invalid(self): req = webob.Request.blank('/v3/versions/1234') req.accept = "application/json" res = req.get_response(fakes.wsgi_app_v3()) self.assertEqual(res.status_int, 404) self.assertEqual(res.content_type, "application/json") def test_get_version_3_detail_content_type(self): req = webob.Request.blank('/') req.accept = "application/json;version=3" res = req.get_response(fakes.wsgi_app_v3()) self.assertEqual(res.status_int, 200) self.assertEqual(res.content_type, "application/json") version = jsonutils.loads(res.body) expected = {"version": EXP_VERSIONS['v3.0']} self.assertEqual(expected, version)

commit_message:
Use v2.1 URLs instead of v3 ones in API unit tests

Now v2.1 API unit tests use fake.wsgi_app_v3() and they specify v3 URLs.
This patch adds wsgi_app_v21() for using v2 URLs in v2.1 API tests and
changes URLs in unit tests.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I5cdd7dd1d435ab0e4e093168f01e96f8dac52e8c

commit_message:
Fix string concatenation

Translated strings should not be added with normal strings. This makes
translations harder and will be an error with oslo.i18n.

Change-Id: I1f0bdd022ff155ed85e98f27f21ec9eed870aa1c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/93/117993/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: message = _("Invalid input received: %(reason)s") message = _("Migration error: %(reason)s") message = _("Quota exceeded: code=%(code)s")
deleted_lines: message = _("Invalid input received") + ": %(reason)s" message = _("Migration error") + ": %(reason)s" message = _("Quota exceeded") + ": code=%(code)s"

deleted_lines: * The Nova Openstack service depends on a sqlalchemy database. If you are using puppetlabs-mysql to achieve this, there is a parameter called mysql_module that can be used to swap between the two supported versions: 0.9 and 2.2. added_lines: # (optional) Deprecated. Does nothing. $mysql_module = undef, if $mysql_module { warning('The mysql_module parameter is deprecated. The latest 2.x mysql module will be used.') } ::openstacklib::db::mysql { 'ceilometer': user => $user, password_hash => mysql_password($password), dbname => $dbname, host => $host, charset => $charset, collate => $collate, allowed_hosts => $allowed_hosts, notify => Exec['ceilometer-dbsync'],
deleted_lines: # (optional) Mysql module version to use. Tested versions # are 0.9 and 2.2 # Defaults to '2.2' $mysql_module = '2.2', Class['mysql::server'] -> Class['ceilometer::db::mysql'] Class['ceilometer::db::mysql'] -> Exec<| title == 'ceilometer-dbsync' |> Mysql::Db[$dbname] ~> Exec<| title == 'ceilometer-dbsync' |> if $mysql_module >= 2.2 { mysql::db { $dbname: user => $user, password => $password, host => $host, charset => $charset, collate => $collate, require => Class['mysql::server'], } } else { mysql::db { $dbname: user => $user, password => $password, host => $host, charset => $charset, require => Class['mysql::config'], } } # Check allowed_hosts to avoid duplicate resource declarations if is_array($allowed_hosts) and delete($allowed_hosts,$host) != [] { $real_allowed_hosts = delete($allowed_hosts,$host) } elsif is_string($allowed_hosts) and ($allowed_hosts != $host) { $real_allowed_hosts = $allowed_hosts } if $real_allowed_hosts { ceilometer::db::mysql::host_access { $real_allowed_hosts: user => $user, password => $password, database => $dbname, mysql_module => $mysql_module, }

commit_message:
Migrate mysql backend to use openstacklib::db::mysql

Implements: blueprint commmon-openstack-database-resource
Change-Id: Ic2711c675fb4a02d7d8e58e1060bded7c72774e6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ironic refs/changes/74/111074/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*password*] # Password to use for the nova user # # [*dbname*] # (optional) The name of the database # Defaults to 'nova' # # [*user*] # (optional) The mysql user to create # Defaults to 'nova' # # [*host*] # (optional) The IP address of the mysql server # Defaults to '127.0.0.1' # # [*charset*] # (optional) The charset to use for the nova database # Defaults to 'utf8' # # [*collate*] # (optional) The collate to use for the nova database # Defaults to 'utf8_unicode_ci' # # [*allowed_hosts*] # (optional) Additional hosts that are allowed to access this DB # Defaults to undef # # [*cluster_id*] # (optional) Deprecated. Does nothing $charset = 'utf8', $collate = 'utf8_unicode_ci', $cluster_id = undef, if $cluster_id { warning('The cluster_id parameter is deprecated and has no effect.') } ::openstacklib::db::mysql { 'ironic': user => $user, password_hash => mysql_password($password), dbname => $dbname, host => $host, charset => $charset, collate => $collate, allowed_hosts => $allowed_hosts, }
deleted_lines: $charset = 'latin1', $cluster_id = 'localzone' require mysql::python mysql::db { $dbname: user => $user, password => $password, host => $host, charset => $charset, require => Class['mysql::config'], } # Check allowed_hosts to avoid duplicate resource declarations if is_array($allowed_hosts) and delete($allowed_hosts,$host) != [] { $real_allowed_hosts = delete($allowed_hosts,$host) } elsif is_string($allowed_hosts) and ($allowed_hosts != $host) { $real_allowed_hosts = $allowed_hosts } if $real_allowed_hosts { ironic::db::mysql::host_access { $real_allowed_hosts: user => $user, password => $password, database => $dbname, } }

deleted_lines: * The Glance Openstack service depends on a sqlalchemy database. If you are using puppetlabs-mysql to achieve this, there is a parameter called mysql_module that can be used to swap between the two supported versions: 0.9 and 2.2. This is needed because the puppetlabs-mysql module was rewritten and the custom type names have changed between versions.

commit_message:
Add API schema for v2.1 "create a server" API

By defining the API schema, it is possible to separate the validation
code from the API method. The API method can be more simple.
In addition, a response of API validation error can be consistent for
the whole Nova API.

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-schema

Change-Id: Ic17d2227909c9180ca86c9d578dad4c73ec57dfc

subject: Expose blacklisting scaled items via merge.py.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-12 03:49:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator/commit/136d24475bb427d7737e5046ad85002d9bc257df', 'message': "Expose blacklisting scaled items via merge.py.

I don't like putting these in as environment variables, but I

commit_message:
Expose blacklisting scaled items via merge.py.

I don't like putting these in as environment variables, but I
suspect the consistency with the matching scale variables outweighs
the rationalise-ui needs in the short term.

Change-Id: Ib11c9ab767a7632717cb0fb277dbbba7c98bd4ee

commit_message:
Added verbiage elaborating on what files are needed for pki_setup.

Further explained what is needed and needing copied when setting
this up.

Change-Id: Ia9fc9f4f142bd322c61bb398dd3e42df7b3c69c7
Closes-Bug: #1321000
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/04/118104/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <note> <para>The copying of the key/cert files may be better done after first running <command>keystone-manage pki_setup</command> since this command also creates other needed files, such as the <filename>index.txt</filename> and <filename>serial</filename> files.</para> <para>Also, when copying the necessary files to a different server for replicating the functionality, the entire directory of files is needed, not just the key/cert files.</para> </note>

commit_message:
Adding firewall logging for instances.

Adding a new configuration switch that would allow, if set to true,
to log DROPped packet aimed at any instances by setting
the following boolean: log_dropped_traffic.

Change-Id: Id74e15788a14b08934c1ec2a19a29a492ccb970c

commit_message:
Convert multiple-create v3 plugin to v2.1

Changes required to have the multiple create v3 plugin natively
support the v2.1 API. The following Server creation parameters
are reverted:

os-multiple-create:min_count -> min_count
os-multiple-create:max_count -> max_count
os-multiple-create:return_reservation_id -> return_reservation_id

Removes min_count parameter for a test which should never have
been included but due to a gap in input validation was ignored.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: Ie435c357958066e9fde40eab54826261ee9d4226

subject: Fix Redis message controller getting stuck in while loop
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-02 16:14:18.000000000', 'files': ['zaqar/tests/queues/storage/base.py', 'zaqar/queues/storage/redis/messages.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/zaqar/commit/16cf9550d475c85f7152237f038adcb986dbec21', 'message': 'Fix Redis message controller getting stuck in while loop

The Redis driver was getting stuck in a loop while trying to create
a claim. The root cause turned out to be some logic that was trying
to skip past all the claimed messages at the head of the queue, but
did not advance the offset if no unclaimed messages were found,
leading to a neverending loop.

Change-Id: I8d2e1a7820c30e92a63ed938013f0e69dff83b2f
Partially-Implements: blueprint redis-storage-driver
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Redis message controller getting stuck in while loop

The Redis driver was getting stuck in a loop while trying to create
a claim. The root cause turned out to be some logic that was trying
to skip past all the claimed messages at the head of the queue, but
did not advance the offset if no unclaimed messages were found,
leading to a neverending loop.

Change-Id: I8d2e1a7820c30e92a63ed938013f0e69dff83b2f
Partially-Implements: blueprint redis-storage-driver
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/92/118392/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO(prashanthr_): Look for better ways to solve the issue. # TODO(kgriffs): Generalize this paging pattern (DRY) offset = 0 while True: msg_keys = self._client.zrange(msgset_key, offset, offset + limit - 1) if not msg_keys: offset += len(msg_keys) messages = [Message.from_redis(self._client.hgetall(msg_key)) for msg_key in msg_keys] for msg in messages: if not utils.msg_claimed_filter(msg, now): return msg.id if not marker and not include_claimed: # NOTE(kgriffs): Skip unclaimed messages at the head # of the queue; otherwise we would just filter them all # out and likely end up with an empty list to return.
deleted_lines: # TODO(prashanthr_): Looking for better ways to solve the issue. marker = 0 # NOTE(prashanthr_): This will not be an infinite loop. while True: msg_keys = self._client.zrange(msgset_key, marker, marker + limit) if msg_keys: messages = [Message.from_redis(self._client.hgetall(msg_key)) for msg_key in msg_keys] for msg in messages: if not utils.msg_claimed_filter(msg, now): return msg.id else: # NOTE(prashanthr_): Iterate through the queue to find the first # unclaimed message. if not marker and not include_claimed:

commit_message:
Add functional test for IptablesManager

Introduce test of IptablesManager using filtering of ICMP packets in
namespaces.

Partial-bug: #1243216

Change-Id: I90ab0d397780247de619bd90f5febd0e59b84fc7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/52/117852/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2014 Red Hat, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from neutron.agent.linux import ip_lib from neutron.agent.linux import iptables_manager from neutron.openstack.common import uuidutils from neutron.tests.functional.agent.linux import base ICMP_BLOCK_RULE = '-p icmp -j DROP' SRC_VETH_NAME = 'source' DEST_VETH_NAME = 'destination' class IptablesManagerTestCase(base.BaseLinuxTestCase): SRC_ADDRESS = '192.168.0.1' DST_ADDRESS = '192.168.0.2' def setUp(self): super(IptablesManagerTestCase, self).setUp() self.check_sudo_enabled() self.src_ns = None self.dst_ns = None self.addCleanup(self.cleanup) self._prepare_veth_pairs() self.iptables = iptables_manager.IptablesManager( root_helper=self.root_helper, namespace=self.dst_ns.namespace) def cleanup(self): for namespace in (self.src_ns, self.dst_ns): if namespace is not None: namespace.netns.delete(namespace.namespace) @staticmethod def _generate_namespace_name(): return "func-%s" % uuidutils.generate_uuid() @staticmethod def _set_ip_up(device, cidr, broadcast='192.168.0.255', ip_version=4): device.addr.add(ip_version=ip_version, cidr=cidr, broadcast=broadcast) device.link.set_up() def _prepare_veth_pairs(self): source_ns = self._generate_namespace_name() dest_ns = self._generate_namespace_name() ip_cmd = ip_lib.IPWrapper(self.root_helper) self.src_ns = ip_cmd.ensure_namespace(source_ns) self.dst_ns = ip_cmd.ensure_namespace(dest_ns) src_veth, dst_veth = self.src_ns.add_veth(SRC_VETH_NAME, DEST_VETH_NAME, dest_ns) self._set_ip_up(src_veth, '%s/24' % self.SRC_ADDRESS) self._set_ip_up(dst_veth, '%s/24' % self.DST_ADDRESS) def _ping_destination(self, attempts=3): self.src_ns.netns.execute(['ping', '-c', attempts, self.DST_ADDRESS]) def test_icmp(self): self._ping_destination() self.iptables.ipv4['filter'].add_rule('INPUT', ICMP_BLOCK_RULE) self.iptables.apply() self.assertRaises(RuntimeError, self._ping_destination) self.iptables.ipv4['filter'].remove_rule('INPUT', ICMP_BLOCK_RULE) self.iptables.apply() self._ping_destination()

commit_message:
LBaaS: agent monitoring and instance rescheduling

For those lbaas drivers that manage physical loadbalancer devices
rather than processes (like HAProxy) it doesn't matter which exact agent
will perform actual managing. So in case one agent fails such
loadbalancer instances may be simply rescheduled to another agent.

Implements blueprint lbaas-ha-agent

Change-Id: I87d5f608b74ab4f1875b1a44108ba817daeb828a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/43/59743/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron import contextfrom neutron.openstack.common import loopingcall cfg.IntOpt('lbaas_agent_monitoring_interval', default=10, help=_('Seconds between inspecting LBaaS agents states ' 'in order to find down agents and reschedule ' 'loadbalancer instances to active agents if any')), # shows whether loadbalancer instances deployed by this driver are # host specific (like HAProxy process-on-host); need to check this # parameter when monitoring agents and rescheduling instances host_specific = False self._setup_agent_monitoring_on_plugin() def _setup_agent_monitoring_on_plugin(self): # check if agent monitoring was already set by other plugin driver if hasattr(self.plugin, 'agent_monitoring'): return self.plugin.agents_states = {} interval = cfg.CONF.lbaas_agent_monitoring_interval if interval: self.plugin.agent_monitoring = ( loopingcall.FixedIntervalLoopingCall( self._check_agents_states) ) self.plugin.agent_monitoring.start(interval=interval) def _check_agents_states(self): """Check agents states and reschedule loadbalancers if needed.""" ctx = context.get_admin_context() agents = self.plugin.get_lbaas_agents(ctx) for agent in agents: active = self.plugin.is_eligible_agent(True, agent) if not active and self.plugin.agents_states.get(agent['id']): # reschedule all instances from that agent to other agents LOG.warning(_('LBaaS agent %(agent_id)s on host %(host)s ' 'became inactive; going to reschedule instances ' 'to other eligible agents'), {'agent_id': agent['id'], 'host': agent['host']}) self._reschedule_instances(ctx, agent) self.plugin.agents_states[agent['id']] = active def _reschedule_instances(self, context, agent): """Reschedule all loadbalancer instances currently hosted by agent For each instance if there is other agent able to host it - reschedule to that agent """ pools = self.plugin.list_pools_on_lbaas_agent(context, agent['id']) for pool in pools['pools']: driver = self.plugin._get_driver_for_pool(context, pool['id']) if driver.host_specific: LOG.warning(_('Can\'t reschedule host specific instance %s'), pool['id']) continue new_agent = self.pool_scheduler.reschedule( self.plugin, context, pool['id'], self.device_driver) if new_agent: self.agent_rpc.reload_pool( context, pool['id'], new_agent['host']) # if agent is back online - it will be notified that no # longer handles the instance self.agent_rpc.destroy_pool( context, pool['id'], agent['host']) else: LOG.warning(_('Can\'t reschedule instance %s: no eligible ' 'agent found'), pool['id']) host_specific = True

commit_message:
Fix Permissions on Postgresql Elements

permissions need to be 0755 to be discoverable by the
diskimage-builder, otherwise they're skipped outright.

Change-Id: I3ba357559d3f7f9f1fdad830bab47fd805d50c7f
Closes-Bug: #1364679

commit_message:
Make a whole host of modules hacking 0.9.2 compliant

Global requirements has updating the version of hacking to a minimum of
0.9.2 and it has brought a whole slew of changes. This CR is to tackle a
bunch of small hacking violations.

Change-Id: Iae1d0f40d2a13bc31cf4e688bda85c0cfd36847b

subject: Make Client-ID a required header
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-02 11:51:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/zaqar/commit/6333bd8e8b91ad6dfe265fbae473825076d821c7', 'message': 'Make Client-ID a required header

commit_message:
Make Client-ID a required header

It was decided to make Client-ID a required header. This patch adds a
new `before hook` that enforces this new rule.

Partially-Implements blueprint: api-v1.1-header-changes

Change-Id: I7b20d56812a0dff4f8ed3e6da75b62ef7c0f307e

commit_message:
Add --exclude-dirs option

In some situations it may be desirable to rely on file discovery but
exclude files within some subdirectories (such as .tox/).

Change-Id: Ibe989d0c96e7827631201d88f024e3e3414254cf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bashate refs/changes/94/115794/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def discover_files(exclude_dirs=None): exclude_dirs = exclude_dirs or [] for root, dirs, filenames in os.walk('.'): # exclude some directories for path in exclude_dirs: if os.sep in path: parent, child = path.rsplit(os.sep, 1) if not child: # path ends with os.sep if os.sep not in parent: if parent in dirs: dirs.remove(parent) continue else: parent, child = parent.rsplit(os.sep, 1) if root.endswith(parent) and child in dirs: dirs.remove(child) else: if path in dirs: dirs.remove(path) # everything that ends in .sh parser.add_argument('-x', '--exclude-dirs', help='Directories to ignore (comma deliminated)') exclude_dirs = opts.exclude_dirs.split(',') files = discover_files(exclude_dirs)
deleted_lines: def discover_files(): # everything that ends in .sh for root, dirs, filenames in os.walk('.'): files = discover_files()
